text: Nabil Elaraby (; 15 March 1935 â€“ 26 August 2024) was an Egyptian diplomat. He was Secretary-General of the Arab League from 1 July 2011 to 3 July 2016. He was Foreign Affairs Minister of Egypt in Essam Sharaf's government from March to June 2011. In December 2008, he became the Director of the Regional Cairo Centre for International Commercial Arbitration. Elaraby died on 26 August 2024, at the age of 89. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Ambassadors of Egypt Category:Politicians from Cairo Category:Secretaries General of the Arab League Category:Cairo University alumni
title: Nabil Elaraby
